result.execSummary:
The defendant Dalton J. Bauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender-Fail/Provide Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(2)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Criminal Case Settlement
with Elements Attached

ADDRESS INFO for Dalton J. Bauer
Current: N7830 Maple Ridge Road, Oconomowoc, WI 53066 United States  (Effective: 10-24-2016)
Prior: 608 1/2 S 7th St Upper, Watertown, WI 53094

Cases 16CF21, 16CF199, and 16CM285 called together at 10:15am [ma]
Defendant Dalton J. Bauer in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; 

Plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1 of Case 16CF199
Plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1 of Case 16CF21

Factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: Count #2 of Case 16CF199 and Case 16CM285

On Count 1 of Case 16CF199, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--batterers intervention counseling or similar programing per Agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay statutory costs, to include domestic abuse surcharge

As to Case 16CF199: Days credit for time already served:  0  days

On Case 16CF21: 
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $250+ costs = $793 to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 11/24/16 and on the 24th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 16 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

As to Case 16CF21: Days credit for time already served:  1 day
recess:10:37am

Cases 16CF21, 16CF199 & 16CM285 called together at 9:10 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Dalton J. Bauer in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

16CF21 & 16CF199: 
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Bauer waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
off-record: 9:13 - 9:16 am for scheduling

16CM285:
Service of Complaint admitted;DOB & address confirmed accurate; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant
Court finds probable cause within the complaint

Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-If Mr. Bauer leaves the home with the child, must notify Miss Retzlaff via text message
-May not leave the State of Wisconsin
-May not leave Jefferson County without Miss Retzlaff
-May not raise voice above a conversational tone
-May not physically take hold of Miss Retzlaff under any circumstances

Court graphs theses conditions of bond into both the felony matters
Recess: 9:25 am

[MK] case called at 1:43pm. 
Defendant Dalton J. Bauer appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--to comply with all requirements of the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry Program
recess 1:45pm.
